intro: Rupicapnos longipes subsp. reboudiana, commonly known as the Sierra Madre flame tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Mexico, particularly in the Sierra Madre Occidental. This shrub or small tree is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in arid and semi-arid landscapes.
